intro: Crucianella graeca, commonly known as the Greek crucianella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is a small shrub that typically grows in coastal and saline environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that release seeds when mature. Crucianella graeca is notable for its ecological importance in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
